page.title: 06Employment
page.content: Employment opportunities for young people are few. Most, especially the career minded, find employment in Aberdeen. This involves either commuting daily which is expensive and time consuming, or moving into a flat or lodgings. The latter alternative is also expensive in the U.K.'s oil capital but is more convenient both for work and recreational activities. Any vacancies which arise locally for females are usually taken up by married women although a few boys are fortunate to be offered apprenticeships with local tradesmen or find work in agriculture. A rural background appears to be a "plus" in the eyes of prospective employers and most young people in our area are in employment although not necessarily in the job they would have liked.
